question: What is the difference between multichannel and omnichannel marketing systems?

answers.text: Multichannel marketing systems are designed primarily for online distribution.

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: That’s not correct. Multichannel marketing systems are not designed to be flexible and seamless.

answers.text: Omnichannel marketing systems are designed primarily for in-store distribution.

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: That’s not correct. Omnichannel systems are not primarily designed for in-store distribution.

answers.text: Omnichannel marketing systems are more flexible and seamless in how consumers can buy and receive products and services.

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: That’s not correct. Multichannel systems are not designed primarily for online distribution.

answers.text: Multichannel marketing systems are more flexible and seamless in how consumers can buy and receive products and services.

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: Omnichannel marketing systems allow consumers to buy and receive products and services seamlessly across a variety of channels, including online and in-store.

detailedSolution: Omnichannel marketing systems allow consumers to buy and receive products and services seamlessly across a variety of channels, including online and in-store.
